com.meltmedia.jgroups.aws
Class AWS_PING

java.lang.Object
  org.jgroups.stack.Protocol
      org.jgroups.protocols.Discovery
          com.meltmedia.jgroups.aws.AWS_PING

public class AWS_PING
extends org.jgroups.protocols.Discovery

A discovery protocol that uses the AWS EC2 API to find cluster members. Membership can be determined by a general filter and/or by nodes that have similar tags. This discovery protocol is designed to work with the TCP protocol.

Requirements

  • The EC2 instances must be in the same region.
  • The "ec2:Describe*" action must be accessable using either IAM credentials or an IAM instance profile.
  • The security rules must allow TCP communication between the nodes that are discovered.

Tag Matching

To use the tag matching feature, use the tags attribute to specify a comma delimited list of tags. All of the nodes with matching values for these tags will be discovered. 

 <com.meltmedia.jgroups.aws.AWS_PING
   timeout="3000"
   port_number="7800"
   tags="Type,Environment"
   access_key="YOUR_AWS_ACCESS_KEY"
   secret_key="YOUR_AWS_SECRET_KEY"/>

EC2 Filters

To use EC2's filtering feature to discover nodes, specify the filters attribute. The format for this attribute is: 

 FILTERS ::= <FILTER> (';' <FILTER>)*
 FILTER  ::= <NAME> '=' <VALUE> (',' <VALUE>)*

EC2 instances that match all of the supplied filters will be returned. For example, if you wanted to cluster with all of the running, small instances in your account, you could specify: 

 <com.meltmedia.jgroups.aws.AWS_PING
   timeout="3000"
   port_number="7800"
   filters="instance-state-name=running;instance-type=m1.small"
   access_key="YOUR_AWS_ACCESS_KEY"
   secret_key="YOUR_AWS_SECRET_KEY"/>

IAM Instance Profiles

Starting with version 1.1.0, instance profiles are supported by AWS_PING. To use the instance profile associated with an EC2 instance, simply omit the access_key and secret_key attributes: 

 <com.meltmedia.jgroups.aws.AWS_PING
   timeout="3000"
   port_number="7800"
   tags="Type,Environment"/>

References

  • EC2 Using Filtering
  • EC2 Describe Instances
  • EC2 Instance Metadata

Author:
Christian Trimble, John McEntire

fetchClusterMembers

public java.util.Collection<org.jgroups.PhysicalAddress> fetchClusterMembers(java.lang.String cluster_name)
Fetches all of the cluster members found on EC2. The host portion of the addresses are the private ip addresses of the matching nodes. The port numbers of the addresses are set to the port number plus all the ports in the range after that specified on this protocol.

Specified by:
fetchClusterMembers in class org.jgroups.protocols.Discovery
Returns:
the cluster members.

getPrivateIpAddresses

Returns:
the list of private IP addresses found on AWS.

getInstanceTags

public static java.util.List<com.amazonaws.services.ec2.model.Tag> getInstanceTags(com.amazonaws.services.ec2.AmazonEC2 ec2,
                                                                                   java.lang.String instanceId)
Returns all of the tags defined on the EC2 instance with the specified instanceId.

Parameters:
ec2 - the client to use when accessing Amazon.
instanceId - the id of the instance to search for tags.
Returns:
a list of the Tag objects that were found on the instance.
